item.title: Singapore Airlines and SilkAir have reduced their fuel surcharges
item.description:
Singapore Airlines and SilkAir, its regional subsidiary, have reduced their fuel surcharges due to decreasing fuel prices. These new surcharge amounts apply to flights from both airlines and range from US$5 to US$83 lower per one-way trip, depending on the flight distance and class of travel. item.title: Starting on January 26, 2015, AirAsia will no longer impose fuel surcharges
item.description:
Starting January 26, 2015, AirAsia, along with its long-haul affiliates AirAsia X, Thai AirAsia X, and Indonesia AirAsia X, will eliminate fuel surcharges on all flights. This decision aligns with the current downward trend in global oil prices. Source: AirAsia eDM. This marks a return to AirAsia’s previous policy from 2008, where fuel surcharges were eliminated on all domestic and international flights.
